definition: lit. compass and set square/fig. established standard/rule/customs/practices/fig. upright and honest/well-behaved
compass/a rule/regulation/to admonish/to plan/to scheme
variant of 規|规[gui1]
variant of 矩[ju3]
carpenter's square/rule/regulation/pattern/to carve
to behave oneself/to abide by the rules
compasses, set square and straight line marker (idiom); fig. established standard/norms/criteria
without rules, nothing can be done (idiom, from Mencius); one must follow some rules
pinyin: bu4 yi3 gui1 ju5 , bu4 neng2 cheng2 fang1 yuan2

definition: without rules, nothing can be done (idiom); one must follow some rules
pinyin: mei2 you3 gui1 ju5 , bu4 cheng2 fang1 yuan2

definition: without rules, how can anything be done (idiom); one must follow some rules
pinyin: mei2 you3 gui1 ju5 , he2 yi3 cheng2 fang1 yuan2

definition: compasses, set square, spirit level and plumbline (idiom); fig. established standard/norms/criteria

sentences.english: Ten nets are exquisite and regular, seemlingly having gained mercy of gods.
sentences.chinese: 网织的精巧而规矩，八卦形的张开，仿佛得到神主。

sentences.english: The clever thing was to break the rules and stay alive all the same .
sentences.chinese: 聪明的做法，是把规矩破得巧，同时又得活得好。

sentences.english: Do we think they are behaving themselves at school?
sentences.chinese: 我们会认为这些学生在学校一直是规规矩矩的吗？

sentences.english: When you go to a new school, you don't know the ground rules of how you are supposed to behave.
sentences.chinese: 当你进入一所新学校，常常不知道有何遵循的规矩。

sentences.english: He inculcates good manners in his children.
sentences.chinese: 他谆谆教导他的孩子们要懂规矩。

sentences.english: I stick to my usual, one bottle of well-chilled Tsingtao beer.
sentences.chinese: 老规矩，来一瓶冰镇青岛啤酒。

sentences.english: The students at the college are passive and respectful .
sentences.chinese: 大学的学生都很规矩恭顺。

sentences.english: Mr. CaeHiew introduces the vacation camp for the kids and has an explanation of camp rules and the regulation.
sentences.chinese: 丘老师为我们介绍假期营，说明营的规矩和章程。

sentences.english: He's a badly-behaved boy. Nobody likes him.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个不守规矩的孩子，没有人喜欢他。

sentences.english: The code to vest the government with unrestricted power is a "bad" code.
sentences.chinese: 赋予政府不受约束之权力的规矩是“恶”法。

sentences.english: He has no decency, no discipline.
sentences.chinese: 他不讲体面，也没有规矩。

sentences.english: Becky was well-behaved at school but Adam was naughty.
sentences.chinese: 贝基在学校很守规矩，但是亚当很调皮。

sentences.english: His handwriting shows care and training.
Let's do it in the way of business.
sentences.chinese: 这件事我们还是按做生意的老规矩办吧。

sentences.english: It's our ritual. None of them will agree to this.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们的老规矩，没人会同意这么做的。

definition: unwritten (rule)
to behave oneself/to abide by the rules
etiquette/(old) gradation of etiquette with social status
etiquette
religious precept/taboo/rule
rules/regulations
superior and subordinate/social ranking
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
rules/regulations/constitution/statute/articles of association (of company)/articles of incorporation/charter (of a corporation)/by-laws
unspoken rules (usually ones that codify improper behaviors such as leveraging guanxi to get favorable treatment, or coercing employees for sexual favors)
to execute/to handle/behavior/action/conduct
to pay particular attention to/carefully selected for quality/tastefully chosen
to violate/to offend
not to allow/must not/can't
to comply with/to follow (directives)/to defer (to the judgment of superiors)
taboo/to avoid as taboo/to abstain from
